dialog.text: How do I know if I'm following my inner compass or someone else's voice?
dialog.instructions: young boy; curious, slightly trembling; breathy tone; moderate speed; hopeful

dialog.text: Listen first — I'm speaking now because I used to be loud inside you. I am your shadow: the hurried part that protected you by warning and blaming.
dialog.instructions: calm, low; warm and steady; wise, slow; soft emphasis on 'I am your shadow'

dialog.text: You were loud? I thought shadows were just... dark. They feel like weights that pull me back.
dialog.instructions: vulnerable; hesitant then honest; small inhale between phrases; soft pacing

dialog.text: Yes. When I was a boy I pointed to every scar and said, 'Don't cross — you'll get hurt.' I kept you safe, but I also drew the map of every stopped step.
dialog.instructions: reflective; confessional; gentle rasp; measured tempo; slight nostalgia

dialog.text: So how do I stop being ruled by that map? How do I befriend you without losing my way?
dialog.instructions: urgent curiosity; leaning forward in voice; quicker cadence

dialog.text: Three small acts. Pause — stop the automatic rush. Name the feeling — fear, shame, anger. Thank me for trying to protect you. Then choose: does this urge point toward love, or toward an old fear?
dialog.instructions: deliberate, rhythmic; guiding breath between steps; encouraging tone; slow enough to follow

dialog.text: And if the urge keeps screaming, dragging me to the shore where I always stay safe?
dialog.instructions: weary; a tiny hope in the end; softer speed

dialog.text: Invite it close. Hold its hand and say, 'I see you. You kept me alive. I will not abandon you, but you won't drive today.' Integration turns your shadow into the needle of your compass — honest, not tyrant.
dialog.instructions: warm and steady; reassuring crescendo; clear decisive final line; compassionate authority

dialog.text: When I do that — listen, thank, choose — will I finally feel free?

Freedom isn't an arrival; it's the daily answer. Each time you choose purpose over habit, the compass points truer. The more you meet your shadow with kindness, the less it will shout — and the more you'll follow your own North.
dialog.instructions: serene, conclusive; slow, softening to a whisper at the end

dialog.text: Try this now: pause for one breath, name whatever rises, thank the part that showed up, then make one small choice that aligns with who you want to be. Share a moment in the comments when you followed your inner compass — or ask a question. Your story could be someone's map.
dialog.instructions: inviting and upbeat; warm call to action; slightly quicker tempo to close; friendly
